title: ICE on ?Sized handling

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

labels.name: regression-from-stable-to-stable
labels.description: Performance or correctness regression from one stable version to another.

body:
This code reproduce it.
https://play.rust-lang.org/?gist=e6f3aa15d3399c3300dd38b0a627cbf4&version=stable

I tried this code:

```
#[derive(Clone)]
struct Node<T: ?Sized>(Box<T>);

impl<T: Clone + ?Sized> Clone for Node<[T]> {
    fn clone(&self) -> Self {
        Node(Box::clone(&self.0))
    }
}

fn main() {}
```

## Meta

`rustc --version --verbose`:

```
rustc 1.24.1 (d3ae9a9e0 2018-02-27)
binary: rustc
commit-hash: d3ae9a9e08edf12de0ed82af57ba2a56c26496ea
commit-date: 2018-02-27
host: x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu
release: 1.24.1
LLVM version: 4.0
```


And an angry imp there! :imp:
